doc.title: GREElectric Appliances (A)
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Gree Electric Appliances A Cut to Neutral on 2Q miss share loss still a high-yield nameGree Electric Appliances A Cut to_2025-08-29

passages.text: Rating Change: NEUTRAL | PO: 51.00 CNY | Price: 47.25 CNY

We downgrade Gree from Buy to Neutral post its 2Q miss, as our previous expectation of revenue uplift from trade- in subsidies are overshadowed by its share loss due to a competitive pricing environment and its late- move with channel reforms. Revenue/NPAT was \(- 12\% / - 10\%\) in 2Q, decelerating from \(+14\% / + 26\%\) in 1Q. We lower 2025/26 EPS by \(6\% /7\%\) , and cut PO 15% to RMB51. Gree's 2Q significantly lagged peers, on meaningful market share loss (a consistent trend in recent years). We attribute its miss to following reasons. (1) China air- con industry becomes increasingly promotional this summer with leading brands launching low- priced SKUs and low- end sub- brands to gain shares in the mass market. However, Gree's pricing has remained largely stable, thus a widening price gap vs. peers. (2) Gree's channel reform is still in the early stage, while leading peers are shifting to a model with higher channel efficiency, digitalization and lower risks for distributors. Going forward, demand pull- forward by trade- in subsidies might lead to industry headwinds and a more promotional environment, which will further pressure Gree. On a positive note, Gree will face much easier comps than peers in 2026 given two consecutive years of revenue declines despite trade- in subsidies. More importantly, as an under- owned stock, Gree now trades at 8.5x 2025 P/E, in line with past 5 years average. Its strong balance sheet could well support an attractive \(5\% +\) dividend yield in a low- interest rate market, offering downside protection.

Revenue was \(- 2.7\%\) YoY in 1H25, implying \(- 12\%\) in 2Q25, decelerated from \(+14\%\) in 1Q25. Consumer electronics segment (largely air- conditioner) was the key dragger of deceleration and declined \(5\%\) in 1H. By region, domestic sales was \(- 5\%\) YoY in 1H, and export was \(+10\%\) , contributing \(73\% /17\%\) of total revenue. GPM contraction (- 52bp) coupled with SG&A/revenue (+59bp) weighted on OPM contraction of 120bp and 19% OP decline. This is in contrast to that of peers, which all posted YoY OPM expansion. Net profit was boosted by below- line items (higher interest income and lower tax rate) and declined \(10\%\) YoY.

Key Metrics \\* For full definitions of iQmethod measures, see page 8.
Electrical Equipment

Gree Electric Appliance was founded in 1991 merging two SOE companies. After more than two decades of development specializing in air- conditioners, Gree is now the largest AC maker in terms of volume in the world. The company was listed on the Shenzhen Stock Exchange in 1996. Apart from residential AC, Gree also tapped into commercial AC, upstream businesses (like compressors, enameled wires, etc), small home appliance, mobile phones and other related products.

We rate Gree as Buy on 1) China's trade- in subsidies (with optionality on further stimulus in 2025), 2) Gree's widening valuation discount to major index, which offers attractive risk reward, and 3) less crowded positioning than other leading white goods peers.
Price to Book Value 1.9x
Exhibit 1: Gree: Earnings revision We lower our 2025/26E estimates by \(6\% /7\%\) respectively

We lower our 2025/26E estimates by \(6\% /7\%\) respectively and cut our PO \(15\%\) to RMB51. Our PO is derived from a 50/50 blend of P/E and DCF. Our DCF value is RMB55.2, based on WACC \(11.6\%\) , beta 0.95x and a lower terminal growth rate of \(1\%\) (vs. \(1.5\%\) previously) to reflect increased uncertainties. Our P/E value is RMB46.8, derived from \(8.5x\) 2025 P/E (vs. 10x previously) which is largely in line with its 5- year average.
Exhibit 2: Gree: 1H25 result at a glance Gree's revenue/core net profit was \(-2.7\% / + 0.6\%\) YoY in 1H25
Source: Company, BofA Global Research estimates
Gree currently trades at 7x fwd P/E, lower than its 5-year average

To reflect both the near- term growth and long- term outlook, we use a blend of P/E and DCF to value Gree. Our PO for Gree is RMB51/share. Our DCF value is RMB55.2/share (WACC: \(11.6\%\) , beta 0.95x, terminal growth \(1.0\%\) ). Our P/E valuation is RMB46.8/share, based on 8.5x 2025E P/E, which is largely in line with its 5- year average. Downside risks: weakness in property sales, lower upgrading demand given weak macro, slow progress of channel reforms, increasing competition, rising raw material prices, value destroying decisions by management. Upside risks: recovery of property sales, faster upgrading demand given macro recovery, smooth progress of channel reforms, moderating competition, falling raw material prices.
